marquee.font: HS, JH and Elem...there is a link on the homepage to order yearbooks! Thursday is homework roll-out day! If you experience any computer issues and need to speak with technology, please call 806-874-2062, ext, 7.

div.h3: High School Yearbooks are now on sale for $45.00.
div.h4: Parents. students can purchase via the link on the ReplayIT app, online at Jostens.com, or we will have order forms in the high school that we can email to parents.
div.h3:
JH and Elementary Students!
Yearbooks are on sale now for $25.00.
Order before May 8th.
Click here to order!

a.aria-label: Read more about HS, JH and Elementary Yearbooks

h3.font: **Beginning April 7, lunch and breakfast will be served together from 9am-11am!

h4.font: ****Reminder: Meals will not be served on Friday, April 10 as it is a scheduled school holiday.

div.h4: The CISD cafeteria will be serving Breakfast and Lunch together from 9am-11:00am.
div.p: Breakfast and lunch will be a grab-n-go option where parents and guardians will drive to a designated area between the back of the cafeteria and front of the Elementary School on West 5th Street. You will not even have to get out of your car. We will pass out meals based on the number of children in the household. All students through the age of 18 are welcome to receive breakfast and lunch each day Monday-Friday.

a.aria-label: Read more about Continuation of Food Service

h3.a: Friday night lights shining brighter at CISD!

div.h4: In honor of our students at Clarendon ISD, we are shining bright with HOPE! The Bronco Stadium lights will be turned on each evening Monday - Friday from 8pm-9pm as a symbol of hope and assurance that CISD puts kids first.
Bronco Nation, the Great State of Texas, and the USA are on our hearts and minds throughout these difficult times.

a.aria-label: Read more about Friday night lights shining brighter at CISD!

div.h4: Watch this video prepared by Mrs. Grahn to get the most out of remote learning at CISD!

h3.a: Letter from Jarod Bellar, Superintendent of Clarendon CISD

div.h4: Mr. Jarod Bellar, Superintendent of CISD, has issued an informational notice to CISD students and parents concerning the status of the COVID-19 outbreak and future school sessions.
Click on the link to read more. COVID-19

div.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

font.bgcolor: The Clarendon Consolidated Independent School District is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, or disability in employment matters, in its admissions, policies, or by excluding from participation in, denying access to, or denying the benefits of district services, academic and/or career and technology programs or activities as required by Title IV of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972; Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended, and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act.
